Demos

511 words written on Thu, Apr 10 2003

In said fear and trembling.

I have updated my music link to go to the daniel wayne miller americana project IUMA page, which has on it 2 new songs‚ÄìAmerican Dream Town and Just Say Yes‚Äìand a new mix of Numb Us, which collectively make up the new demo. I also threw up the old stuff worth keeping.

IUMA isn‚Äôt great, but it is a lot better than mp3.com now‚Ä¶as many songs as you want, can seperate them into ‚Äúalbums‚Äù, and a Real audio format. I didn‚Äôt have any problems uploading the mp3‚Äôs. No strings attached; I just hope they can stick around; they had an emergency a year and a half ago and almost went bye-bye; fortunately someone bought them and kept the site up. It‚Äôs a charity gig for them I‚Äôm sure.

mistakes we knew we were making:

‚ÄúTheese town, theese American Dream Touuuun?‚Äù

Yes. This is alt.country after all. Sort of. Think an uptempo Nick Cave.

Drums and voice way out front?

Yeah. My Korg recorder should have a big sticker on it: ALL YOUR MIDTONES ARE BELONG TO US. Sounds good in the ‚Äòphones.

Numb US vocal 2?

Yeah. Couple fuck ups that I kept. I say ‚Äúever‚Äù instead of ‚Äúeven‚Äù one time, and it‚Äôs so far back it‚Äôs practically an audio easter egg, but at the end of the bridge I was trying to sing the octave on an already high note and my voice just stopped and I said ‚Äúshit‚Äù.

Second drum track on American Dream Town?

The Hip Hop 2 setting. Old school baby. Flipped the channels during mixdown. Highlight of the whole thing for me was nailing it coming out of the bridge. Not exactly like playing the drums, but considering what I‚Äôve got (just what‚Äôs built into the Korg), I think I do a good job.
